result.execSummary:
The defendant Traveon Alonta Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Court orders that the defendant must serve 2-Years before he is eligible for the programs.

Consecutive to: 21CF276

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid during term of confinement and as a condition of extended supervision.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with:  victims

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling
 
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  7 YEARS

Extended Supervision:  4 YEARS
Sentence to run Consecutive to 21CF0276.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
Court orders that the defendant must serve 2-Years before he is eligible for the programs.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victims
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant enters a no-contest plea to count 3. Court conducts plea colloquy with the Defendant. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count 3. Counts 1-2, 4-7 are dismissed and read-in. Cases #21CF821 and 21CV961 are dismissed and read-in.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Traveon Alonta Coleman
Current: 515 W moreland blvd, Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 03-18-2022)
Prior: 319 Dodie Dr,#4, Waukesha, WI 53189

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

03:21 PM Defendant Traveon Alonta Coleman in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez for attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Mark Kershek will be appointed to this case as well.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Court notes Victim A's last name may be spelled incorrectly.  State moves to orally amend Victim A's last name for purposes of the protective order.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
